content.sql:
WITH source AS (SELECT paper_id, distance FROM papers p WHERE distance = 0 LIMIT 1),
    similar AS (SELECT paper_id, distance FROM papers p WHERE {{filters}} ORDER BY adamic_adar + COALESCE(cocite, 0) DESC LIMIT 44),
    important AS (SELECT paper_id, distance FROM papers p WHERE {{filters}} ORDER BY page_rank DESC LIMIT 5)
SELECT paper_id, distance
FROM (
    SELECT paper_id, distance FROM source
    UNION
    SELECT paper_id, distance FROM similar
    UNION
    SELECT paper_id, distance FROM important
)

content.title: Similar Papers
content.subtext: These papers cite the same papers as your selected paper.  They tend to bias towards newer papers in the field.
content.emptyMessage: We could not find any similar papers.  This is often because the source paper does not have any outgoing citations.
content.sql:
SELECT paper_id, doi, authors, title, adamic_adar + COALESCE(cocite, 0) as similarity, published_year, num_cited_by
FROM papers p
WHERE {{filters}}
AND (adamic_adar > 0 OR cocite > 0)
ORDER BY similarity DESC, page_rank DESC

content.title: Most Important Papers in the Graph
content.subtext: These are the "Most Important" papers as ranked by PageRank.  These tend to be the older papers in the field.
content.sql:
SELECT paper_id, doi, authors, title, page_rank, num_cited_by, published_year
FROM papers p
WHERE {{filters}}
ORDER BY page_rank DESC, adamic_adar DESC

content.title: Recent Papers by the Top 100 Authors
content.sql:
SELECT p.paper_id, doi, authors, title, num_cited_by, published_year, adamic_adar
FROM (
	SELECT paper_id
	FROM (
		SELECT name
		FROM authors a
		JOIN papers p ON p.paper_id = a.paper_id
		GROUP BY a.name
		ORDER BY SUM(p.page_rank / (
			CASE 
				WHEN num_authors < 4 THEN num_authors
				WHEN a.sequence = 1 OR a.sequence = num_authors THEN 3
				ELSE num_authors * 3
			END)) DESC
		LIMIT 100
	) ta 
	JOIN authors a ON a.name = ta.name
	GROUP BY paper_id
) a
JOIN papers p ON p.paper_id = a.paper_id
WHERE p.published_year > (strftime('%Y', 'now') - 3)
AND {{filters}}
ORDER BY adamic_adar DESC, page_rank DESC

content.title: The Most Important Recent Papers
content.sql:
SELECT paper_id, doi, authors, title, page_rank, num_cited_by, published_year
FROM papers p
WHERE p.published_year > (strftime('%Y', 'now') - 3)
AND {{filters}}
ORDER BY page_rank DESC, adamic_adar DESC

content.title: Other Data
content.subtext: This section highlights other interesting data related to the network.

content.title: Top Authors
content.subtext: This section tries to identify the top authors in the network.
content.sql:
SELECT name as author_name, SUM(p.page_rank / (
	CASE 
		WHEN num_authors < 4 THEN num_authors
		WHEN a.sequence = 1 OR a.sequence = num_authors THEN 3
		ELSE num_authors * 3
	END)) as total_page_rank, COUNT(*) as num_papers
FROM papers p
JOIN authors a ON p.paper_id = a.paper_id
WHERE {{filters}}
GROUP BY a.name, name
ORDER BY SUM(page_rank) DESC

content.title: Institutions
content.subtext: This section tries to identify the top institutions in the network.
content.sql:
SELECT affiliation, SUM(page_rank) as total_page_rank, COUNT(*) as num_papers
FROM papers p
JOIN (
	SELECT paper_id, affiliation, affiliation_id
	FROM authors
	GROUP BY affiliation_id, affiliation, paper_id
) a ON p.paper_id = a.paper_id
WHERE {{filters}} AND a.affiliation <> ''
GROUP BY  a.affiliation_id,a.affiliation
ORDER BY SUM(page_rank) DESC

content.title: Top Journals
content.subtext: This section tries to identify the most relevant journals for this research area
content.sql:
SELECT journal, SUM(page_rank) as total_page_rank, COUNT(*) as num_papers
FROM papers p
WHERE {{filters}}
AND journal <> ''
GROUP BY journal
ORDER BY SUM(page_rank) DESC
